Paper No, (40) 504 of the 2.9th June Iraised certain questions regarding the preparation ofmore troops in India for service overseas. These have of sta:now been considered by the Chiefs of Staff Committee, andtheir conclusions are recorded in CCS. Paper No. (40) 558of the 25th July which will come before the War Cabinet(W.P.(40) 291).It will be seen that their Report includes proposals'as to the provision of equipment by His Majesty'sGovernment (conclusion (b)), and a recommendation that theGovernment of India should be informed as to the extent ofthe further requests for troops which it is anticipatedthat His Majesty's Government will have to make (conclusion(c)).On the assumption that the Report will be approved bythe War Cabinet I ask for authority to communicate theCommittee' s conclusions to the Government of India and toascertain their ability to comply with the requirementsdetailed therein.In communicating these requirements I ask permission to give the Government of India a definite authority to start forthwith the necessary preparations for forming the.three divisions mentioned in conclusion (c), and also toraise such units in replacement as may be necessary inorder to meet India's own defence requirements.
